episode_title: 406 - The One With The Dirty Girl

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and a beautiful blonde (Cheryl) are standing outside. The rest of the gang is watching from inside.

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: So, thank you for the delicious dinner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re welcome for a delicious dinner.
[inside]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey what are you guys looking at?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross and the most beautiful girl in the world .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, come to papa.
[Cheryl walks away and Ross walks inside. Everyone stares at him in disbelief.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Probably the only time I’ll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where did you, when did you, how did you… (Joey hits the back of Chandler’s head) How did you get a girl like that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, so what is she, like a… like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics instructor, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually she’s a paleontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the centazoic era.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but that’s, like, the easiest era.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her dinner. We had a great time. And we’re going out again tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can bring home the biggest geek.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine by me; hope she wins.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s. Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oo! Is it for my birthday present?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but remember you said you ordered something special, and it just hasn’t come yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I have a call in about that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’kay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, this is for Kathy’s birthday. It’s an early edition of her favorite book.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, The Velveteen Rabbit ! Oh my God, when the boy’s love makes the rabbit real!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but don’t touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. Well, then you’d better keep it away from Ross’s hair. So this is pretty rare. How did you get that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it wasn’t a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked to a couple of dealers… called a couple of the author’s grandchildren.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey, that’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and what a great way to say, "I secretly love you, roommate’s girlfriend!"

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It doesn’t say that. Does it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How do you think it’s gonna look when you get her something incredibly meaningful and expensive and her boyfriend Joey gives her an orange?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, all right, I’ll just uh, make sure that uh, Joey gets her something really great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s gotta be better than that book. Oo! Like a crossbow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye. (To the gang) I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.
content.parenthetical: Entering from her bedroom, talking on the phone

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! What happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sixty guests .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, why did you have to turn it down?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because I don’t have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there’s no way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, what is with all the negativity? You sound like Monican’t , not Monican… (Monica looks almost puzzled) …Monica. Look, you know, you have been playing around with this catering thing for over three years. Do you want to be a caterer or not?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There you go, that’s the spirit! Okay! Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Cause I’d need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! It’s worth it, if it will get you moving. You haven’t worked in months.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you’re not working either.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, but I’m doing this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, that’d be great! Thank you!
[Joey enters]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Everyone
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Can I borrow the keys to your apartment?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?
[Kathy whispers something in Joey’s ear]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can pee here!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Ahahaha… haha.. yes I can, of course. Excuse me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s okay, the duck’s using our bathroom anyway. (Kathy goes into the bathroom.) Hey Joe! What are you getting Kathy for her birthday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ve only been going out for a couple of weeks, do you think I gotta get her something?

content.speaker: Everyone
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, you have to get her something, and it should be something really nice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I know…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And not one of your coupons for an hour of "Joey Love."
[cut to a new scene, also in Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Rachel is sitting, Phoebe is nearby.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooo, a crossword! Can I help?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! I’m sorry, honey, it’s just that last week I got all but three answers and I really want to finish a whole one without any help.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine. But you can’t help me develop my new universal language.
[Monica enters]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, how’d it go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow—the dead-guy-from-today’s best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mon! I’m so happy for you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff. (Picks up two frying pans) Look at this! I’m an omelet station! Omelet? Made to order!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll have one, please. Plus my money.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Well, I didn’t realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I… I used it to buy all this stuff. But look—I’ve got another job tomorrow, so I’ll pay you back with the money I make from that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Okay. Oo, sorry I acted like a bank.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Outside Cheryl’s apartment, Ross and Cheryl are kissing

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh…

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Um, would you like to come in?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did homo-erectus hunt with wooden tools?

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: According to recent findings!

[They go into the apartment. Inside the apartment it looks like a sewage dump exploded and landed in her living room. There are clothes and food and junk covering every square inch of space. I mean pigs have nicer pens. Ross is completely shocked.]

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Here Mitzi! Here Mitzi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mitzi is…

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: My hamster. I hope she’s okay, I haven’t seen her in a while. Have a seat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh… Oh hey, do you, uh (steps on some garbage and falters) …do you have any , um, Cinnamon Fruit Toasties?

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I do! Why don’t we go back to my place, light a couple of candles, break open a box of Cinnamon Fruit Toasties, uh…

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: I’d rather not.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah, why not?

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Okay, um, don’t take this the wrong way, but your place kinda has a weird smell.

content.description: A kitchen where Phoebe and Monica are finishing up a catering job

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, is everything in the car?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Did you settle the bill?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. I hate this part.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look what we almost left. (Picks up a coffee maker)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, that’s not mine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, all right. Oh! Look what we almost took!
[cut to the living room of the same dwelling, where the funeral guests are mingling. Monica enters.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me, Mrs. Burkart? Well, we’re all cleaned up in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: Oh, good. Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, and, well there’s the.. the the small matter of…

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: Dear?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just the matter of …payment?

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: Jack used to handle the finances! (Breaks into tears)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is on the couch still doing the crossword. Chandler is in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what we should all do? Go see a musical.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you know which one we should see? The 1996 Tony award winner. Do you happen to know the name of that one?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know… um, Grease?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rent?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Rent!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so when do you want to go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Oh, I’m sorry, I can’t, I’m busy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. Man, it is so hard to shop for girls.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, it is, at Office Max .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What did you get her? (Joey opens up a rectangular black box and holds up a pen.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A pen .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s two gifts in one. It’s a pen that’s also a clock! Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh-huh! You can’t give her that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because she’s not eleven! And it’s not the seventh night of Hanukkah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, honey, what he means by that, is …while this is a very nice gift, maybe it’s just not something a boyfriend gives?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure it is! She needs a pen for work, she’s writing, she turns it over… "Whoa! It’s time for my date with Joey!"

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, look, look. What did… what did you get for Angela Delveccio for her birthday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She didn’t have a birthday while we were going out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For three years?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, it’s too late, and I got an audition. I can’t shop anymore! I…
content.parenthetical: whining and heading toward the door

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. I will go out and I will try to find something for her, okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, man. And oh, while you’re at it, could you get her a card?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you like me to write her a little poem as well?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or… just get a card that has a poem already in it.

content.description: Back in the kitchen at the funeral. Phoebe is there, Monica enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But Mon, you have to get our money!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Phoebe, she couldn’t stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, it’s tough. You know what the first thing I did after my mother’s funeral was?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Pay the caterer! Look, I’ve had a lot of jobs, okay, and there are some people who just always try to get out of paying. It’s either, you know, "that massage wasn’t long enough, or, "I don’t recognize any of those songs," or, you know, "these sombreros aren’t big enough. Bad little white girl!"

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. So what do you… you think she’s faking?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it seems like there weren’t any tears ’til you showed her the bill.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.
[cut to the living room where Mrs. Burkart is now performing.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: You’re a grand ol’ flag, you’re a high-flying flag, and forever in peace may you wave…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She seems fine now.

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: …emblem of the land I love. The home of…

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Joey are standing and talking, Ross is tying a tie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you just left? Her place was really that bad?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know how you throw your jacket on a chair at the end of the day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, like that, only instead of a chair, it’s a pile of garbage. And instead of a jacket, it’s a pile of garbage. And instead of the end of the day, it’s the end of time, and garbage is all that has survived! (Ross takes the loosely tied tie off and hands it to Joey who puts it on.) Here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow. Thanks. So, uh, what happened?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you mean? Nothing happened! I had to get out of there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, so… next time, you take her to your place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I tried that. She says it has a weird smell.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What kind of smell?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. Soap ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, listen, Ross… you like this girl, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You wanna see her again, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’re gonna have to do it in the mess!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay you’re right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean, uh, who… who cares about a little sloppiness?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s, uh… it’s endearing, really.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Now you go get that beautiful pig! (Ross hesitates, looks unsure) Oink!

content.description: Monica and Rachel, Rachel is there, Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, all right. I just spent the entire afternoon looking for a present for Kathy that would be better than the rabbit .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Any luck?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I found this great place called "Invisible things for Kathy." (Motions to an imaginary pile of presents next to him.) Can you give me a hand with all this stuff?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, look. Why don’t you just return the book, let Joey give her the clock pen, and you give her something worse than that. Like… a regular pen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s really going to love this, you know? The bottom line is I want her to have it, even if I don’t get to be the one who gives it to her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw, honey, that’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah? You don’t think it’s just pathetic?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Pathetic! (Grabs the crossword puzzle and starts writing.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I’m meeting Kathy in ten minutes! I’ve been looking all over for you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Our place, the hall! I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got something for her. (Joey picks up the package, shakes it next to his ear, can’t hear anything, switches ears, shakes it again.) It’s a book!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A book? (Suddenly interested) Is it like a book that’s also a safe?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s a book that’s just a book, okay? It’s an early edition of the Velveteen Rabbit . It was her favorite book as a kid. So, uh, just… let me know if she likes it, okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it. Thanks man. Thanks for doing this, I owe you one. (Joey leaves, comes back in.) Oh, hey! There wasn’t any change from that twenty, was there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it came out to an even twenty.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow. That’s almost as much as a new book.

content.description: In the living room at the funeral

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: Jeepers, creepers, where’d you get those peepers? Jeepers, creepers, where’d you get those eyes?
[cut to Monica and Phoebe in the kitchen]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t get the money, did you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on… you know what? Let’s just go!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Hey, we’re not leaving until we get paid! I don’t know who she thinks she is! Enough is enough! (Phoebe goes into the living room.) Hey, widow?

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: Come on along and listen to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, Widow!

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: …the lullabye of…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me. Excuse me! (Mrs. Bukart stops singing) Thanks. Um, clearly this is a very, very hard time for you. Um, but, um, we provided a service, and we deserve to be paid because you ate that service, and, um, we are not leaving here until we’re paid every penny. ’Cause you know what, lady? We’re part time caterers, and we have no place else to go.

content.speaker: Mrs. Burkart
content.text: All right. I’ll get my bag.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good. (Phoebe and Mrs. Burkart go into the other room, leaving Monica with everyone staring at her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: So you want to come inside?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes I do. (They go inside.)

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: I’ll be right back. Make yourself comfortable. (Ross attempts to clear a place for his coat and fold it small enough to fit. Then hit sits on the couch. Something falls on him from above and he brushes his neck off frantically.)

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Guess who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Department of Sanitation?

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: It’s me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! (She kisses him) Ah. (They kiss more, and move down onto the couch. Ross’s hand moves under some garbage) Aw! (His hand is covered with something brown and gooey.)

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, Cheryl!
content.parenthetical: trying to make his disgust into lust

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Oh, Ross!

[They sit up, moaning in excitement, and Cheryl straddles Ross. Ross finds a slice of bologna and moans higher and louder, then a bag of potato chips on the coffee table starts to move. Ross throws Cheryl off his lap, grabs a tennis racket and a toilet brush and starts pounding the bag.]

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Wait! No! No! It’s my hamster! It’s Mitzi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god! I’m so sorry, Cheryl. I must have freaked out.

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Oh, thank god, it’s not Mitzi. It’s just a rat.

content.description: Central Perk. Rachel is sitting on the couch alone. Gunther is there, going into the back room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did it! Oh! I finished it! I did it all by myself! And there’s nobody to hug!
[From the background we hear a crash and Gunther comes running out of the back room, pushing people aside, reaching for Rachel.]

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Move!
[Gunther slips and falls just before reaching the back of the couch. Monica and Phoebe come into Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey, you guys, I finished the crossword all by myself! Hug me!
[Gunther gets up slowly from behind the couch and walks away sadly]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh… yay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s great! Congratulations!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you! Hey, how’d the catering go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn’t pay, so Phoebe yelled at her ’til she did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. I’m a hard ass.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I’m a wuss. And we should be partners.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Hard Ass and Wuss. We could fight crime!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! You’re not working right now, and we have such a great time together!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can cook and you can take care of the money.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Oh! It’ll be like I have a wife in the fifties!

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Aah!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is there, Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, how’d it go? How’d she like the gift?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, man, she loved it! She’s over there showing Monica and Rachel right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah? That’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, listen, I gotta tell ya, I feel kinda bad taking credit for this, because man, am I gonna get a lot of credit for this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [nodding, with mixed feelings] Aahhuuhhh…
[Kathy enters]

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Happy birthday.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know, uh… [Joey moves the pen case out onto the counter.] Chandler got you a gift, too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No he didn’t. [Moving it back.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, he did, look… look, it’s right there on the counter! Ha-ho-ho!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy birthday! I’m sorry .

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: You really didn’t have to. (Opens the box) Wow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, you think it’s just a pen, but then you turn it over and it’s also a clock .

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Yeah. No, this is great. Thank you, Chandler. (They hug).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah… yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah. Hm. (To Kathy) Wanna go to bed?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I’ll be in in a minute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, uh… don’t forget your coupon. (Tries to strike a sexy pose up against the doorway to his room. Then goes inside).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to Kathy] Goodnight.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Um, thank you for the gift.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh, yeah… I just knew that sometimes when you’re writing, you… you don’t always know the exact time.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, I… I didn’t mean the pen. Thank you for the book.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, the book?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: The Velveteen Rabbit. I kinda have the feeling you had something to do with it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Well, uh, when Joey gave it to me, he said, "This is ’cause I know ya like Rabbits, and I know ya like cheese." Thanks. I love it. And I know how hard it must have been for you to find.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhl..ell. By the way, in case you missed that, that sound was, "Uhl, ell."

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: You must really like… Joey… to go to all that trouble for him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, he’s my… he’s my best friend.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Goodnight. (Goes to his room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, that coupon expires, you know.
[ending credits scene: outside Cheryl’s apartment, Monica knocks on Cheryl’s door]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Uh, you… you don’t know me, I’m Monica Geller… Ross’s sister.

content.speaker: Cheryl
content.text: Oh, yeah. Oh, you know, that’s too bad that didn’t work out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn’t sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?
[Cheryl shrugs, shuts the door, looking puzzled]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No?
[Monica looks around the hallway, pulls out a sponge and starts scrubbing the door frame.]
